headline: Tucker: Cory Booker invented his own identity
sentences: DEVINE: And, you know, the thing about Cory Booker, and his performance is that it was all about "Look at me" and you played that bit that was really the whole point of it, which is, he says, you know, when he's trying to take claim for her nomination, and you know, he's talking about being in the office with the President when he was deciding and, you know, looking into Kamala Harris's eyes, because he knows the Vice President really well.
